name: Balancing Moringa Oil Cleanser
description: Balancing Moringa Oil Cleanser: a simple cleanser for oily skin made with soothing moringa and tamanu oils.
recipe: Gently warm moringa and tamanu oils, if needed, until they are fully melted and in a liquid state.
Carefully measure each ingredient, then combine in mixing vessel and agitate until well blended.
Transfer mixture to bottles

name: Aloe Cucumber Makeup Setting Spray
description: Aloe Cucumber Makeup Setting Spray: a cooling facial spray to help fix and mattify cosmetics.
recipe: Combine hydrosol, distilled water, witch hazel, and aloe vera gel in a small vessel and mix well.
Add glycerin, lactococonut and lactobacillus ferments.
Test ph and adjust if necessary using citric acid, baking soda, or your preferred acids and alkalizers. The final ph of this spray should be between 5.5 and 6.
Transfer to clean, sterile bottles with spray nozzles trimmed to fit.

name: Papaya Tamanu Facial Oil
description: Papaya Tamanu Facial Oil: a balancing facial serum that encourages healthy, clear, and radiant skin.
ingredients: 30 ml Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, melted
recipe: Heat coconut oil in double boiler until fully melted.
Remove oil from heat and set aside for 5 minutes or until slightly cooled.
Add tamanu, papaya, hibiscus, and sacha inchi oils and mix well.
Add essential oils and mix again.
Transfer to bottles.

name: Rose Frankincense Scar Balm
description: Rose Frankincense Scar Balm: a nourishing moisturizer to support damaged skin.
ingredients: 30 ml Organic Virgin Rose Hip Seed Oil
0.65 Organic Rose Damascena Select CO2 Extract
recipe: Place beeswax in double boiler and heat until fully melted.
Add olive squalene and vitamin e oil and heat until melted again.
Remove from heat and let stand 2 minutes.
Add rose hip seed oil, co2 extracts, and essential oil. Mix well.
Transfer melted mixture to glass jars and let cool until fully hardened before capping.

name: Balancing Clay Facial Mask
description: Balancing Clay Facial Mask: a deep-cleansing facial mask made with two kinds of cosmetic clay and a special blend of essential oils to promote healthy, glowing skin.
ingredients: 5 ml Organic Virgin Rose Hip Seed Oil
0.65 ml Organic Rose Geranium Essential Oil
0.65 ml Organic Melissa (Lemon Balm) Essential Oil
recipe: Place the black clay in one container, and the glacial clay in another.
Add 30 ml of each hydrosol, along with 0.65 ml of the lactobacillus ferment to the glacial clay and stir well until blended.
Add 30 ml of each hydrosol, along with 0.65 ml of the lactobacillus ferment to the black clay and stir well until blended.
Combine the rose hip seed oil with essential oils, then divide the blended oils equally between the two clay mixtures.
Mix each well, then transfer to jars or use right away.

name: Nourishing Jojoba Brow Balm
description: Nourishing Jojoba Brow Balm: an all-natural conditioning balm for eyebrows
ingredients: 0.65 ml (1/8 teaspoon) Tea Tree Essential Oil
1.65 ml (1/8 teaspoon) Frankincense Select CO2 Extract
recipe: Combine jojoba wax and beeswax in double boiler and heat until fully melted.
Add jojoba to melted waxes and stir until well blended.
In a separate bowl, combine ungurahui oil with black oxide.

name: Coconut Aloe Cleansing Balm
description: Coconut Aloe Cleansing Balm: a deep cleaning oil cleanser made with virgin coconut and aloe.
recipe: Combine coconut oil, aloe butter, shea butter, and castor oil in double boiler and heat until fully melted.
Remove from heat and let cool 3-5 minutes.
Add essential oils and mix slowly until fully blended.
Transfer to jars and let cool until fully hardened.

name: Cooling Cucumber Avocado Ice Mask
description: Cooling Cucumber Avocado Ice Mask: a refreshing facial mask made with Palo Santo and Andean Mint Essential Oils.
ingredients: 60 grams fresh aloe vera gel (or 30 ml bottled)
recipe: Combine avocado, cucumber, and aloe vera in small food processor and blend until smooth.
Transfer to bowl and add essential oils. Stir well.
Fill silicone or steel molds with about 15 ml (1 tablespoon) of mask in each cavity.
Cover, and freeze until fully hardened (about 1 hour).

name: Dead Sea Mud & Palo Santo Mask
description: Dead Sea Mud & Palo Santo Mask: a deep cleansing facial mask with soothing Palo Santo and Lavandin essential oils.
ingredients: 0.65 ml (1/8 teaspoon) Palo Santo Essential Oil
0.65 ml (1/8 teaspoon) Tea Tree Essential Oil
recipe: Combine mud and hydrosol in a small container and blend well.
Sift in bladderwrack powder and stir again. Mix in essential oils and transfer to jars.

name: Cucumber Neroli Facial Spray
description: Cucumber Neroli Facial Spray: a soothing and refreshing facial spritz made with natural hydrosols
recipe: Combine ingredients in small beaker and mix well.
Transfer to glass or aluminum bottle with sprayer.

name: Sea Clay & Aloe Vera Facial Mud Mask
description: Sea Clay & Aloe Vera Facial Mud Mask: An exfoliating and deep cleansing mask infused with palmarosa and sandalwood
ingredients: 3 drops of Organic Royal Hawaiian Sandalwood Essential Oil
recipe: Combine French green clay, sea clay, aloe vera powder, and silk powder and sift together to remove clumps.
In a second vessel, combine camellia oil with essential oils and mix well.
Blend the oils into the powders slowly and mix until powders are fully saturated.

name: Coconut Clay Facial Scrub
description: Coconut Clay Facial Scrub: A dry facial scrub made with coconut and yellow illite clay
ingredients: 5 drops Royal Hawaiian Sandalwood Essential Oil
recipe: Combine baking soda with essential oils in small bowl and mix until well blended.
Add clay, mix together, then strain through sifter to remove lumps.
Add coconut and mix well.

name: Balancing Ylang Ylang Facial Oil
description: Balancing Ylang Ylang Facial Oil: A light and moisturizing facial skin care blend featuring organic jojoba, frankincense, and myrrh.
ingredients: 10 ml (2 teaspoons) Organic Clear Jojoba Oil
10 ml (2 teaspoons) Virgin Rose Hip Seed Oil
5 ml (1 teaspoon) Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, melted
8 drops Organic Ylang Ylang Essential Oil
recipe: Combine ingredients in small beaker and mix well.
Transfer to roll-on or dropper type bottles.

name: Strawberry Seed Oil Serum
description: Strawberry Seed Oil Serum: A soothing night time facial moisturizer made with antioxidant rich carrier oils.
ingredients: 1 ml Organic Helichrysum Italicum Essential Oil
recipe: Combine ingredients in a small bottle or beaker and mix well.
Transfer to dropper bottles.

name: Berry Seed Facial Cream
description: Berry Seed Facial Cream: A simple emulsion of nutritive berry seed oils and fragrant hyrdosols.
recipe: Combine water and oil phase ingredients in two separate heat-proof containers. Warm each container until solid ingredients are fully melted. Try to get both containers to about the same temperature before proceeding to step two.
Slowly drizzle the water phase ingredients into the oil phase ingredients while whisking continuously. Continue to whisk vigorously until the mixture cools and thickens. (This may take 5-10 minutes.)
Add additives to thickened cream and mix well until they have been fully blended.

name: Hibiscus Honey Clay Facial Scrub
description: Makes about 40 grams
recipe: Combine hibiscus petal powder and rose clay in a small bowl and whisk together.
Add hibiscus oil, Manuka honey, and essential oils. Stir well to combine.

name: Coconut Honey Turmeric Facial Scrub
description: Coconut Honey Turmeric Facial Scrub: an all-natural scrub with honey and coconut
recipe: Combine coconut, honey powder, and turmeric in a small bowl and whisk together. Transfer dry ingredients to a jar and store until ready for use.
Combine castile soap, sacha inchi oil, and lemon balm hydrosol in a small bottle and shake well. Add to dry ingredients when ready for use.
Stir ingredients together, then use right away.

name: Lavender & Sea Clay Mask
description: Makes about 4 ounces (by volume)
ingredients: 2 teaspoons honey or 1 teaspoon Honey Powder
recipe: Combine sea clay and powdered herbs in small mixing bowl and whisk together.
Add hydrosol and essential oil then whisk until smooth.
Transfer to jar. Use right away or store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.

name: Oatmeal and Chamomile Foaming Cleanser
description: Makes about 8 ounces (240 ml)
ingredients: 8 ounces (240 ml) Shea Butter Shower Gel Base or any gentle liquid soap*
3 tablespoons (60 ml) Baby Blue Jojoba Wax Beads
3 tabkesooons (60 m) Sierra Blue Jojoba Wax Beads
3 tablespoons (60 ml) White Jojoba Wax Beads
1 tablespoon and 1 teaspoon (20 ml) Oat Oil**
1 teaspoon (5 ml) German Chamomile Essential Oil
recipe: In a small mixing bowl, combine shower gel base, kaolin clay, oat oil, oat flour, and essential oil. Whisk slowly until smooth.
Fold in jojoba wax beads and transfer mixture to jar or wide mouthed malibu squeeze bottle.

name: Eucalyptus Spearmint Shaving Soap
description: Makes one 8-ounce container
ingredients: 8 ounces (240 grams) Hemp Melt and Pour Soap Base
1 tablespoon (15 ml) Organic Virgin Coconut Oil
recipe: Chop soap base and heat in double boiler over high heat until completely melted. Add coconut oil.
Mix clay and glycerin with just enough water to form a smooth slurry. Slowly mix slurry into melted soap base, then remove base from heat.
Add essential oils to base, if using, then stir well to combine.
Pour soap into an 8-ounce mug, jar, or other wide-mouthed vessel. Allow to cool until completely hardened before use.

name: Clay Facial Masks – Three Ways
description: Related
recipe: Mix arrowroot powder and essential oil until the oil has been completely absorbed.
Add Clay and whisk until thoroughly blended.

name: Manuka Honey & Banana Facial Mask
description: Makes about 2 servings
ingredients: 1/8 teaspoon (0.75 ml) Organic German Chamomile CO2 Extract
1/8 teaspoon (0.75 ml) Calendula Total CO2 Extract
recipe: Warm Andiroba Oil and CO2 Extracts gently by submerging sealed bottled in a shallow bath of hot water. Water bath should reach half-way up the bottle. Do not submerge above the neck of the bottle.
Meanwhile, whisk together the banana and manuka honey.
Combine 1 teaspoon (5 ml) Andiroba Oil and 1/8 teaspoon (0.75 ml) of each CO2 Extract in small mixing bowl. Stir together until ingredients are well blended, then whisk into banana honey mixture.
Add the Kaolin Clay, and mix until wet ingredients have been fully absorbed.

name: Kiwi Seed Facial Mask
description: Makes 1-2 servings
ingredients: 5 drops Roman Chamomile or Yarrow Essential Oil
recipe: Combine ingredients in a small bowl and mash thoroughly until well blended.
Use right away, or refrigerate for up to three days.

name: Sweet Fennel Facial Steam
description: Makes about six 1/2-ounce (15g) servings
recipe: Combine the Dead Sea Salt and Linden Blossom CO2 Extract in a small bowl and stir well.
Toss the salt with the herbs and flowers.

name: Peaches & Cream Facial Scrub
description: Makes one portion
recipe: Combine the peach, yogurt, Oat Straw Extract, Peach Kernel Oil, and Honey in a blender and pulse until smooth.
Stir in the Oatmeal.

name: Fresh Rose & Almond Milk Beauty Treatments
description: Makes about 3/4 cup
recipe: Combine the raw almonds and water in a small container. Refrigerate overnight.

Drain and rinse the soaked almonds then place them in a blender or food processor. Add the Hydrosol, then blend on full speed for 1 – 2 full minutes, or until the almonds have been completely pulverized.

Strain the mixture through a nut bag, fine mesh strainer, or a cheesecloth. Reserve the fresh almond meal in a separate container. This milk can also be made in a juicer by adding the almonds and Hydrosol simultaneously.

name: Hydrating Watermelon Rind Facial from Blah Blah Magazine
description: We are thrilled to be featuring a post today from Cybele Masterman, author of Blah Blah Magazine. Cybele has shared some really beautiful and creative beauty recipes on her site. From skin soothing lotions to foaming cleansers, Cybele has a way of making her homemade beauty recipes extra special. This week’s hydrating facial is no exception. Thank you, Cybele, for sharing your recipe with us!
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Plain Yogurt (or equivalent yoghurt powder)
recipe: In a small mixing bowl, combine grated Watermelon Rind, Plain Yogurt and Geranium Essential Oil. Mix the ingredients well.
Remove the mixture and transfer it to a clean container.
Refrigerate the mixture for up to three days, then discard it.

name: Guest Post: Hydrating Watermelon Rind Facial from Blah Blah Magazine
description: We are thrilled to be featuring a post today from Cybele Masterman, author of Blah Blah Magazine. Cybele has shared some really beautiful and creative beauty recipes on her site. From skin soothing lotions to foaming cleansers, Cybele has a way of making her homemade beauty recipes extra special. This week's hydrating facial is no exception. Thank you, Cybele, for sharing your recipe with us!
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Plain Yogurt (or equivalent yoghurt powder)
recipe: In a small mixing bowl, combine grated Watermelon Rind, Plain Yogurt and Geranium Essential Oil. Mix the ingredients well.
Remove the mixture and transfer it to a clean container.
Refrigerate the mixture for up to three days, then discard it.

name: Sacha Inchi Facial Serum
description: Makes about 1 ounce
ingredients: 1/2 ounce Organic Rose Hip Seed Oil
recipe: Combine the Sacha Inchi and Rose Hip Seed Oils in a small beaker or cup.
Add the CO2 Extract and Essential Oils, then mix well to combine.
Carefully transfer the serum to a bottle.

name: Getting Started With the Oil Cleansing Method
description: My skin is way too oily after cleansing.
recipe: To use the oil cleanser, start by immersing your washcloth in hot water. The water should be at the highest heat you find comfortable on your face and hands. You don’t want to scald your skin, but you do want to generate a good amount of steam.
Place the hot, wet washcloth over your face, and leave it there for about 30 seconds.

Remove the cloth, and pour about one or two teaspoons of Oil Cleanser into your palm. Gently massage the cleanser onto your face in a circular motion. Oil cleansing experts recommend massaging your skin for about two minutes for best results.
Allow the cleanser to sit on your skin for about thirty more seconds.
Wet the washcloth again in hot water, and place it over your face for another ten to twenty seconds.
Rinse the washcloth again in hot water, then use it to gently rub the oil off of your skin. Repeat this step at least three times, or until you are sure that all the oil has been removed.
Follow with a toner. You can make your own all-natural toner from Hydrosols.
Give your pores a few moments to close back up again, then apply your favorite moisturizer or facial oil, if your skin feels dry.
